result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J McGowan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Patrick J McGowan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Patrick J McGowan was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. McGowan to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year. 

This sentence is to commence consecutive to Walworth County Case #13CF206

superMiscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge

--To undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars or taverns
--Monthly testing for illegal drug use
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

Arresting Agency:  Fort Atkinson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:55 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Patrick J McGowan in court, in-custody, with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. McGowan waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information: Arraignment--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #4
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses outright Count #3

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. McGowan to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year. This sentence is to commence consecutive to Walworth County Case #13CF206

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--To undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars or taverns
--Monthly testing for illegal drug use
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $75 blood testing fees
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 12:29 pm

NEXT: Counsel to submit stipulation regarding sentence credit if applicable within 30 days
Status conference on November 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 1:38 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Patrick J McGowan appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that Mr. McGowan is eligible for SPD Representation

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; charges/penalties recited for Count #1 & #2; reading waived
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $500 CASH bond, with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances or prescribed medications without a valid prescription 
-No possession of drug paraphernalia including syringes without a valid documented need

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 10/22/14 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 11/14/14 at 10:00 am - Send notices
